newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares reverse losses at close, F&N down.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares reverse losses at close, F&N down.

text.p: Singapore shares reversed losses in late afternoon trading on Wednesday as retail punters chased Malaysian over-the-counter shares.
"The market just started moving again following Malaysia. I think the market was a bit oversold," said a broker with a local firm. The UOB-OTC index ended sharply higher at 1,329.97, up 16.54 points.

Soft drinks group Fraser & Neave slumped to a new year low of S$12.50 (US$8.74), down 40 cents. "People are disenchanted with F&N. Its property earnings are drying up and drinks side is facing a lot of start up costs," said an analyst at a foreign firm.
The benchmark Straits Times Industrial index ended up 3.09 points at 2,192.53. Total market volume was 342 million shares with 269 gainers against 118 losers.
Topping the actives was newly-listed Omni Industries which ended at S$0.76 against its offer price of S$0.45.
OUB Bank foreign topped the gainers list with a 40 cent rise to end at S$11.10. Dealers said the sell-down at the start of the week over the bank's exposure to Thai banks was unwarranted.
DBS Bank foreign ended down 30 cents to S$18.10 ahead the release of its results on Thursday.
